page.title: 09Tairmeibion Farm
page.content: The cycle of grass cutting,slurry spreading and eventual reseeding of a field would carry on indefinitely unless a farmer decided to change his farming policy. The grass which the slurry is spread over is used as winter feed for the cattle by making it into silage.A few chemicals are added to the grass as it is chopped and pumped mechanically into one of the two silos at 100 mph.The 75ft.high silo on the farm holds 600_700 tonnes of silage.This feeds 130 cows for approx. 7 months over a winter period.Mr Williams uses 70 acres of his land to produce silage.The grass is cut twice a year usually in early June and towards the end of July.Silage is the main crop at the farm similar to the majority of farms in North Wales.
